div.p: Linnean Society of London, Archives, Guard Book 1880-85, f. 133.

I am greatly beholden to you, dear Mr Jackson, for your attentive kindness of sending me a copy of your Gerard and of your Turner.
Gerard (1876); W. Turner (1877). Jackson's editions included notes and a biographical sketch in each case. For Gerard he includes both 1596 and 1599 editions of the Catalogus, and cross references to his Herbal (Gerard (1597)); there is a copy at MEL of each of these editions. These are two most important works historically and for tracing chronologically authorities. You deserve great credit for rescuing these two publications from oblivion, and for proving such an excellent commentator.

The complete first part (Vasculares) of the chronologic and geogr. census of Austral. plants
B83.03.04. will go to the L.S. at the end of next month, when you you
you repeated.
will get also a copy. Did you receive my edition of Wittstein,
Wittstein (1878), i.e. B78.06.09. brought out a few years ago on private expense of mine with additions. If you have not got it, I will gladly send you a copy.
